title: Inclusive Instructional Design for Higher Education Mathematics: Mobile Microlearning Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Providing Accessible Smartphone-Based Learning Environments for In-Service Secondary Mathematics Teachers. Applies Universal Design for Learning (UDL) Principles to Accommodate Diverse Learner Needs

learning_goals: Learners can propose at least three strategies to apply the three UDL (Universal Design for Learning) principles (engagement, representation, action/expression) to math lessons
Learners can design one inclusive math assessment tool (quiz/activity) accessible solely via mobile devices
Learners can design UDL-based mathematics lesson plans applicable to real classroom environments through project-based assessments.

resources: UDL (Universal Design for Learning) Guidelines Handout
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
